@description.name: @description
@description.body:
*****************************************************************

qooxdoo - the new era of web development http://qooxdoo.org Copyright: 2004-2011 1&1 Internet AG, Germany, http://www.1und1.de License: MIT: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT See the LICENSE file in the project's top-level directory for details. Authors: Martin Wittemann (martinwittemann) *

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The purpose of this class is to contain all checks about css. This class is used by {@link qx.core.Environment} and should not be used directly. Please check its class comment for details how to use it.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks what box model is used in the current environment.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} It either returns "content" or "border".
@return.description: It either returns "content" or "border".

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the (possibly vendor-prefixed) name the browser uses for the textOverflow style property.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null} textOverflow property name or null if textOverflow is not supported.
@return.description: textOverflow property name or null if textOverflow is not supported.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if a placeholder could be used.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true, if it could be used.
@return.description: true, if it could be used.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the (possibly vendor-prefixed) name the browser uses for the appearance style property.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null} appearance property name or null if appearance is not supported.
@return.description: appearance property name or null if appearance is not supported.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the (possibly vendor-prefixed) name the browser uses for the borderRadius style property.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null} borderRadius property name or null if borderRadius is not supported.
@return.description: borderRadius property name or null if borderRadius is not supported.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the (possibly vendor-prefixed) name the browser uses for the boxShadow style property.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null} boxShadow property name or null if boxShadow is not supported.
@return.description: boxShadow property name or null if boxShadow is not supported.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the (possibly vendor-prefixed) name the browser uses for the borderImage style property.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null} borderImage property name or null if borderImage is not supported.
@return.description: borderImage property name or null if borderImage is not supported.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the type of syntax this client supports for its CSS border-image implementation. Some browsers do not support the "fill" keyword defined in the W3C draft (http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-background/) and will not show the border image if it's set. Others follow the standard closely and will omit the center image if "fill" is not set.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean|null} true if the standard syntax is supported. null if the supported syntax could not be detected.
@return.description: true if the standard syntax is supported. null if the supported syntax could not be detected.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the (possibly vendor-prefixed) name the browser uses for the userSelect style property.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null} userSelect property name or null if userSelect is not supported.
@return.description: userSelect property name or null if userSelect is not supported.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the (possibly vendor-prefixed) value for the userSelect style property that disables selection. For Gecko, "-moz-none" is returned since "none" only makes the target element appear as if its text could not be selected

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null} the userSelect property value that disables selection or null if userSelect is not supported
@return.description: the userSelect property value that disables selection or null if userSelect is not supported

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the (possibly vendor-prefixed) name the browser uses for the userModify style property.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null} userModify property name or null if userModify is not supported.
@return.description: userModify property name or null if userModify is not supported.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the vendor-specific name of the float style property

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null} cssFloat for standards-compliant browsers, styleFloat for legacy IEs, null if the client supports neither property.
@return.description: cssFloat for standards-compliant browsers, styleFloat for legacy IEs, null if the client supports neither property.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the (possibly vendor-prefixed) name this client uses for linear-gradient. http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css3-images/#linear-gradients

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null} Prefixed linear-gradient name or null if linear gradients are not supported
@return.description: Prefixed linear-gradient name or null if linear gradients are not supported

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the (possibly vendor-prefixed) name this client uses for radial-gradient.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null} Prefixed radial-gradient name or null if radial gradients are not supported
@return.description: Prefixed radial-gradient name or null if radial gradients are not supported

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if only the old WebKit (version < 534.16) syntax for linear gradients is supported, e.g. linear-gradient(0deg, #fff, #000)

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the legacy syntax must be used
@return.description: true if the legacy syntax must be used

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if rgba colors can be used: http://www.w3.org/TR/2010/PR-css3-color-20101028/#rgba-color

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true, if rgba colors are supported.
@return.description: true, if rgba colors are supported.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the (possibly vendor-prefixed) name the browser uses for the boxSizing style property.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null} boxSizing property name or null if boxSizing is not supported.
@return.description: boxSizing property name or null if boxSizing is not supported.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the browser-specific name used for the display style property's inline-block value.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if CSS opacity is supported

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if opacity is supported
@return.description: true if opacity is supported

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if CSS texShadow is supported

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if textShadow is supported
@return.description: true if textShadow is supported

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the Alpha Image Loader must be used to display transparent PNGs.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the Alpha Image Loader is required
@return.description: true if the Alpha Image Loader is required

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if pointer events are available.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if pointer events are supported.
@return.description: true if pointer events are supported.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns which Flexbox syntax is supported by the browser. display: box; old 2009 version of Flexbox. display: flexbox; tweener phase in 2011. display: flex; current specification.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} flex,flexbox,box or null
@return.description: flex,flexbox,box or null
